info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern McDowell, east central Buncombe and southeastern Yancey Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 249 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Marion, or near B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Black Mountain, Old Fort, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Lake James, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, Montreat, Busick and Pleasant Gardens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
